title: Karate Camp 2019
description: The camp date is Friday (Evening) 30th August - Sunday (Noon) 1st September. We will be training at the lovely Waitawheta Camp. Expect fun, games and a lot of training! Sign ups close 28th July midnight

title: Annual General Meeting
description: The club will be having it's Annual General Meeting in September, which involves the election of club exec members. The meeting will be after training and food and beverages will be provided. Please fill out the form if you wish to nominate someone for a position.

title: Pukekohe Tournament
location: Pukekohe Indian Community Hall, 55 Ward Street
description: The bi-annual Pukekohe tournament is set to have its second event of the year on Saturday 21st September. As usual, kata (solo and teams of at least three) and shiai sparring (point sparring) are on the schedule. There are no pre-requisites for entering the tournament, the club covers entry fees and people with any level of experience are welcome. Starts at 9am. If you want more details regarding the tournament, feel free to ask. If you’re interested in participating then please fill out the sign up form.

title: The Goju Guys Seminar
description: A training seminar focusing on ‘Goju‘ karate as presented by practitioners from different Goju schools.

title: 2019 National Gasshuku
description: One of New Zealands top MMA fighters and Goju Ryu practitioners Gareth Lewis will be teaching

title: 40th IOGKF Sekai Budosai
description: The 40th IOGKF Sekai Budosai (World Budo Festival) is a week long training camp hosted in Okinawa, taught by some of IOGKF's most skilled and highest ranking instructors.

title: Semester 1 Grading
location: The Hawks' Nest, Floor 3, 492 Queen Street
description: Our first grading of the year will occur near the end of semester one.

title: Semester 2 Grading
location: The Hawks' Nest, Floor 3, 492 Queen Street
description: Our second grading of the year will occur near the end of semester two.

title: End of Year Beach Training
description: Training at the beach to wrap things up for the year. Lunch afterwards.
extendedDescription: We'll be having a beach training at Mission Bay after our final Rec Center training. We'll be having a enf of year lunch afterwards. Remember to bring sunblock and a towel! Sunglasses/sunhats are optional.

title: Taira Seminar Pre-Training
location: Pakuranga Goju Ryu, Sunnyhills Primary School
description: Free pre-training before the seminar. Runs from 7pm - 8pm, however feel free to show up from 6pm to do your own thing before the adults training starts.
extendedDescription: Runs form 7pm till 8pm. Covers the core drills that are used in Taira Sensei's teaching method. Hosted by Sennen Sensei at Pakuranga Goju Ryu, Sunnyhills Primary School, Pakuranag. Contact Matt for more details.

title: Taira Sensei Bunkai Seminar
location: Karate Remuera Dojo, 6 Papahia Street, Parnell, Auckland
description: Pakuranga Dojo for the third year have the pleasure again of co-hosting in Auckland one of the greatest exponents of Kata and Application (Bunkai) in the world today. Taira Sensei is well known for his research of the Kata and its true meaning along with his exceptional Kobudo skills. Sensei's Bunkai is based on functionality and practicality, if you've been to one of his Seminars you walk away dazzled by his skill yet always wanting more. Don’t miss this outstanding opportunity.
extendedDescription:
Pakuranga Dojo for the third year have the pleasure again of co-hosting in Auckland one of the greatest exponents of Kata and Application (Bunkai) in the world today. Taira Sensei is well known for his research of the Kata and its true meaning along with his exceptional Kobudo skills. Sensei's Bunkai is based on functionality and practicality, if you've been to one of his Seminars you walk away dazzled by his skill yet always wanting more. Don’t miss this outstanding opportunity.
Taira Masaji Sensei (9th Dan) is the chairman of Okinawa Goju Ryu Kenkyukai. Student of Eiichi Miyazato Sensei who was a senior student of Chojun Miyagi Sensei, founder of Goju Ryu Karate.
Taira Sensei will be teaching his unique training methods, focusing on kata applications. The entire seminar will have attendees working in pairs, learning and drilling kata applications, and to train other drills which would support the applications. Come and experience Taira Sensei present the dynamics of Gojuryu kata bunkai and have most of your what-if questions answered.
This 2 day seminar/workshop is open to all styles, and practitioners with a Goju Ryu background will especially benefit.
Last year we had the seminar in two different Dojos, I felt this was too confusing. I could not secure both days at my Dojo again this year, so Sensei Murray has kindly agreed to have this seminar at Remuera Dojo.
Venue:
Saturday 2nd November 2019 12.00pm to 5.00pm (5 hours) 
Sunday 3rd November 2019 12.00pm to 5.00pm (5 hours) 
o	Karate Remuera Dojo, 6 Papahia Street, Parnell.

Cost: $145 total (covering one or both days).
Bank Account details: Pakuranga Goju Ryu Karate.    Kiwibank:  38 9011 0562835 01
Please include ‘Taira’ as reference along with your name. And also complete the required 2019 Registration Form. :)


More information:

title: Goju Guys 2020
description: The second Goju Guys seminar is scheduled to happen 1st-3rd of May 2020. More details to come.
